subject: For Joel  Re: FOR LC Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Prototype Spirit ...
author: Ron Lederer
full_text:
--0-485507730-1204645575=:10498
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

So Joel, I am standing here next to my trusty RS 125 and I have about 100 feet of cable running out the window, up to my roof, and wrapped around my water tank a bunch of times...now how do I stick this thing into the radio.  I assume I need to take out the screw to the antenna and then...what...shove in the copper cable....or...run into town to look for a place that sells a ______?  Someone had posted a part name but I cannot find the post...I think it was for the fitting to go into the antenna hole.  Or, my way would be to wrap the copper wire around the actual existing radio antenna and then duct tape it all together.
   
  I did check out the www.hard-core site you sent.  I am going to call my rigging a Loop-de-Loop Water-Ion EVP Radiation System (or LLWERS to make it easier to remember). 
  Watya think?  Ron L

LC Duplatt <lcdupla@...> wrote: 
          Thanks for all the help (Zack, Joel, Frank S., etc) for Ron, 
everyone. 

Ron you writing this all down? You just have to keep experimenting 
with the antenna, and you'll be picking up broadcasts out of the US, 
I suspect! LOL

LC

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Joel Smith <shadow71414@...> wrote:
>
> http://www.hard-core-dx.com/nordicdx/antenna/wire here a link for 
a antenna sight for you this should help . i had a great one in 
till i did the caculations and discovered that it would be 95feet by 
35 feet had to put that one on the back burner i couldn't explain 
that to the neighbors about the box and all lol. also i grounded 
the minney box and now we have more station than we know what to do 
with , i used a copper drain pipe under the sink lol i' belive that 
will use what they call a L antenna there a lot of info hope this 
will elp you 
> joel 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
>
